jorisvandenbossche commented on pull request #5873: ARROW-7217: [Python] Use correct python version in Github Actions
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5873#discussion_r348462119
 
 

 ##########
 File path: .github/workflows/python.yml
 ##########
 @@ -73,7 +73,7 @@ jobs:
       matrix:
         python: [2.7, 3.6]
     env:
-      PYTHON_VERSION: ${{ matrix.python }}
+      PYTHON: ${{ matrix.python }}
 
 Review comment:
   I first thought to do this as well, but in all other places (like cmake config etc), we are using PYTHON_VERSION and not PYTHON, so therefore opted to change it here
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

jorisvandenbossche commented on pull request #5873: ARROW-7217: [Python] Use correct python version in Github Actions
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5873#discussion_r348462810
 
 

 ##########
 File path: ci/docker/conda-python.dockerfile
 ##########
 @@ -25,7 +25,7 @@ ARG python=3.6
 COPY ci/conda_env_python.yml /arrow/ci/
 RUN conda install -q \
         --file arrow/ci/conda_env_python.yml \
-        python=$PYTHON_VERSION \
+        python=${python} \
 
 Review comment:
   Question: what does the ``ARG python=3.6`` line a little bit above do? that 'python' is not related to the ${python} here?
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

kszucs commented on pull request #5873: ARROW-7217: [Python] Use correct python version in Github Actions
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5873#discussion_r348467867
 
 

 ##########
 File path: .github/workflows/python.yml
 ##########
 @@ -73,7 +73,7 @@ jobs:
       matrix:
         python: [2.7, 3.6]
     env:
-      PYTHON_VERSION: ${{ matrix.python }}
+      PYTHON: ${{ matrix.python }}
 
 Review comment:
   The docker build time parameters are the docker `ARG`s. We want to install the appropriate python version from Conda in build time, so we need to pass the python version as an `ARG`. 
   
   The `python` arg is defined in the [docker-compose file](https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/docker-compose.yml#L289) and it refers to the `$PYTHON` environment variable, which is read by docker-compose. The default values for the docker-compose environment variables are defined in the .env file.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

 COPY ci/conda_env_python.yml /arrow/ci/
 RUN conda install -q \
         --file arrow/ci/conda_env_python.yml \
-        python=$PYTHON_VERSION \
+        python=${python} \
 
 Review comment:
   See my comment above and the docker file [reference](https://docs.docker.com/engine/reference/builder/#arg)

issuetype.description: A new unit, integration or system test.

fields.description:
The "AMD64 Conda Python 2.7" build is actually using Python 3.6. 

This python 3.6 version is written in the conda-python.dockerfile: https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/ci/docker/conda-python.dockerfile#L24 
and I am not fully sure how the ENV variable overrides that or not

cc [~kszucs]
fields.summary: ARROW-7217: [CI][Python] Use correct python version in Github Actions

comments.body: Ah, I see that there is a PYTHON_VERSION in the dockerfile, but the github action workflow uses PYTHON
